pycommon.actors.actor – Actor library¶

An implementation of the actor model.

A queue manager must be created somewhere, and started:

qm = ActorManager(address=('localhost', 5000), authkey='actor')
qm.start()

An actor inherits from ThreadedActor or ProcessActor, and it implements the method act():

class MyActor(ThreadedActor):
    def act(self):
        self.receive({
            'foo': lambda msg: None
            })
class pycommon.actors.actor.Actor(name)[source]¶

Bases: object

Messages to the actor have the form:

{'tag': 'foo',
 ...}
act()[source]¶

Subclasses must implement this method.

get_actor_ref(name)[source]¶

Get a reference to actor named name.

receive(patterns, timeout=None)[source]¶

patterns have the form:

{a_tag: a_method_name,
 a_tag_2: a_function,
 ...}

Special tags are:

  • *: matches any tag
  • timeout: is executed when a receive times out
class pycommon.actors.actor.ActorManager(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: multiprocessing.managers.BaseManager

An actor manager handles the creation of actors and delivers references on demand.

It must run before starting the actors:

m = ActorManager()
m.start()

For using it:

m = ActorManager()
m.connect()
foo = m.get_actor_ref('foo')
foo.send(msg)
get_actor_ref(name)[source]¶

Get a reference to an actor:

x = m.get_actor_ref('foo')
x.send(...)
class pycommon.actors.actor.ActorRef(q, name)[source]¶

Bases: object

An actor reference.

me()[source]¶

Name of the actor pointed by this reference. Use it for sending self references in the messages:

{'tag': 'reply_me',
 'sender': self.me()}
send(msg)[source]¶

Send a message to the actor represented by this reference.

class pycommon.actors.actor.ProcessActor(name)[source]¶

Bases: pycommon.actors.actor.Actor

An actor running in an independent process.

class pycommon.actors.actor.ThreadedActor(name)[source]¶

Bases: pycommon.actors.actor.Actor

A threaded version of an actor. It runs as a daemon thread.
